narratives.question_text: What was valuable about this class, either in format or content?
comments: This is the most valuable sound class I have taken thus far. I realize this is vague but I have nothing further to say than that

Charles Coes was very organized and informative on the subject matter her presented. He had handouts on all information that was excellent. Charles was available for questions during the class and could explain things very well.

It was a chance to have an expert in the room to ask technical questions about important issues in sound engineering. A lot of the content I would not be able to learn on my own, or would even know where to start.

narratives.question_text: Are there adjustments, additions or deletions that might be beneficial?
comments: More class experiences that have hands on activity.
There was not a great deal of feedback on the assignments that were turned in. Some comments would have been helpful in identifying shortfalls or good approaches that were used.
More practical work is always good. Meeting in the cage and having hands on tutorials was always a good experience.

narratives.question_text: Were there any particular challenges that were difficult to overcome?
comments: Charles had work assignments that caused him to be away on class days. We tried to mitigate this with Skype calls but these often failed due to data issues.

narratives.question_text: Do you have any comments about the teaching/learning environment?
comments: During classes when Charles was present, or during practical session in the Cage, the sessions were particularly effective. We should have a backup plan for a more reliable video/teleconference capability available to YSD for general use by teaching staff.

narratives.question_text: Please provide any other constructive comments below.
comments: Personally, with the amount of information to learn, two class weeks would allow more of the content to sink in.
This was a good continuation of the engineering bootcamp. I still have many questions but as almost all the content was new to me I feel like it was a good introduction.
